content.question: Which of the following statements best characterizes the activities of the Medici family described in Lorenzo’s diary?

choices.label: The Medicis’ lavish public and charitable spending was generally consistent with humanist ideals of political behavior.
The Medicis’ unbridled pursuit of wealth was in direct conflict with humanist ideals of pursuing moderation and avoiding excess in all aspects of life.
The Medicis’ attempts to install themselves as the rulers of Florence ran counter to humanists’ preference for representative democracy.
The Medicis’ support of antiquated forms of popular entertainment, such as jousts, fit in well with the humanists’ interest in preserving the heritage of past historical periods.

content.answer: The Medicis’ lavish public and charitable spending was generally consistent with humanist ideals of political behavior.
